required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Conor Cobalt Chromium Reservoir Based Stent With Sirolimus Elution in Native Coronary Artery Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-Center Study of the Conor Cobalt Chromium Reservoir Based Stent (NevoTM) With Sirolimus Elution in Native Coronary Artery Lesions (NEVO RES-II)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the target lesion failure rate of the NEVO Sirolimus-eluting Coronary Stent System.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The NEVO™ stent will not be commercialized. Cordis decided to close the study after 3 years. This decision took the absence of safety signals into account.

intervention.description: Intervention will consist of percutaneous coronary intervention for treatment of lesions in native coronary arteries using standard coronary intervention techniques. Intervention will include treatment with the NEVO™ Sirolimus-eluting Coronary Stent System.

overall_official.affiliation: Klinik für Innere Medizin III, Universitätsklinikum des Saarlandes

facility.name: Klinik für Innere Medizin III, Universitätsklinikum des Saarlandes
